Identify asteroids¶

Fast, flexible resolution of asteroid designations.

From the command line¶

Use rocks identify or just rocks id

From a script¶

from rocks.identify import identify

identify(‘1950 RW’) identify(‘RioDeJaneiro’) identify(3728) identify(‘SCHWARTZ’) identify([‘SCHWARTZ’, 1, ‘2012 AB’])

from rocks import Rock, rocks, identify

Guidelines¶

The key to speed is a succesful, local look-up on the first try.

  • Use numbers if possible

  • Misspelled names are the largest source of errors: MontyPython does not resolve. Use the number or designation instead.

The bottleneck is performance are the GET queries to quaero. For these, we use asznchronous single-threaded python processes

Queries fail silently if not specified otherwise! If a name cannot be resolved the methods return NaNs

Quick fix tries: - Insert whitespace in front of capitalized letter - Insert - in front of capitalized letter
